COLLABORATION MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING



Between \\ PURDUE UNIVERSITY and \\ GENERAL ELECTRIC


OVERVIEW

This Memorandum of Uuderstanding ("MOU") between Purdue University, a non-profit, educational institution organized and existing under the taws of the State of Indiana with administrative offices al 670 Purdue Mall. West Latayetle, IN 47907 ("Purdue") and Gencral Flectric Company, including its subsidiaries and aflitiates ("(iE"), acting through (iE Global Research, a corporation with offices an One Research Circle. Niskayuna. NY 12309 ("(it"), cither or both of which may also hereinater be referred to respectively as a "Party" or the "Parties," serves as a statement of broad mutual understanding between our heo organizations regarding our stratceic colfaboration, approaches to cooperation. and indicators of success. Purduc hases its engagement with (iLi on its strategic goals for University-level industry engagement. (il: bases its engagement with Purdue on corporate strategic objectives.

We recognize the atonomy of each organization and enter into this MOU in a spirit of mutual trust. respect and a shared commitment to collaborative activities, research and discovery. This MOU is therefore a statement of mutual inten. The MOU expresses a commitment hy both parties to explore opportunities and engage resoures (e.g. staff. faculty, curriculum, materials. researeh and development) for the advancement of collalkation projeets and goals.

This collaboration focuses on suceessful cooperative opportunities in the area of advanced manufacturing. Through a strengthened relationship. Gila and Purdue seck to further cach oher's missions through enhancing institutional and organization congagements in such work.

Support for this instifutional collaboration is endorsed at the executive levels of the administration of (iF: and Purdue as evidenced by the signatures below.

TERM OF COLLABORATION

The term of this MOU shall extend from (October 1. 2014 10 September 30, 2019, unless carlier terminated in accordance with the provisions sed ferth in this MoU. This MOU may be extended upen mutual written agreenent by the Parties. For the purposes of this agremem, all referenced years are calendar years.

RESEARCII AND DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES
(ila and Purdue commil to basing this collaboration on the following key areas:
- Advanced mamulacturing
- Technology transition
- Manulacturing inmoration
- Enhanced engagement opportunitics

From (il:'s perspective. the partnership between GF and Purdue is expected to ereate value to achieve the objectives of its corporate strategy in the following ways:
- Recruitmen of top notel, $21^{\prime \prime}$ Century advanced manufacturing technologists
- Advancement of manufacturing technologies through sponsored researeh
- Acceleration of advanced manubeturing technology introduction by leveraging extensive expertise and facilities
- Expansion of continuing education opportunities in advanced manuacturing for (iE professionals

From Purdue's perspective. the partnership is expected to ercate value in the following ways:
- Sponsored rescarch
- Experiential and project-based learning for graduate and undergraduate students
- Real-world problem solving

Specilic. mutually agrecabie collaborative opportunties in the advanced manulacturing space could take many forms inclading but not limited to:
- Sponsored research projects
- Teaming on Pederal finding opportumities
- Voluntary Supporl (gift funding)

For specifie collaborations under this MOU, it is anticipated that separate written agreements will be entered into by (ile and Purdue for Researeh and Development activities it the advanced manufacturinge space. Such agrements may take the form of sponsored research agrements. researeh collaboration agreements, or other types of agrements (each such agrement generally referred to within this M()U as a "Program Agreement" for case of referemee).

The Parties agree to conduet regular meetings in order to diseuss the progress of existing activities and to identify new opportanities for engagement.

STUDENT ENGACEMENT OPPORIUNIIIES

In order to engage students in the partnership, the Parties wish to support specilie activities that direetly involve Purdue students with Gil: in a variety of ways. Examples of student engagement activities include student organizations, case competitions. senior design projects and others. Support for student activities will be provided by (if: independent of the funding provided for in this MOU.

OTHER COLLABORATIVE OPPORTUNTTIES

The establishment of this MOU shatl in no way limit the additional collaborative opporminies that may exist or become available to the Parties. These additional opportunities may be discussed as ideas are conceived by either Party and may include the funding of an advanced manufacturing lab at Purdue, the comstruction of an educational and research facility on Purdues campus, endowments, or any other activity that is mutually agreable to the Parties.

FINANCIAI. MATTERS

GE Support for this effort is expected to be achieved through a combination of 1) Sponsored Research.
2) other types of funding ("GE Contribution") and 3) GE COSt Share. The total program funding provided

by GE, including Sponsored Research, GE Contributions and GE Cost Share activities on this program, over the course of the term, shall not exceed $\$ 10,000,000$. The Parties' obligation to collaborate on any specific activity as part of this collaboration will be subject to the execution of a specific Program Agreement (or instance of an existing Program Agreement) governing that activity.

Sponsored Research: Sponsored Research funding shall be paid as defined in the appropriate Program Agreement employed to govern such Sponsored Research. The general expectation is to allow for an initial payment upon the signing of the appropriate Program Agreement followed by subsequent payments based on completion of jointly identified deliverables.

GE Contribution: Expenditures of GE Contributions shall conform to existing University policy and shall be used to support the collaborative interests of the parties. Such GE Contributions may include, but are not necessarily limited to, education (including research projects); acquisition of equipment; development and enhancement of educational and outreach programs; and for travel, planning, coordinating and other administrative expenses, as well as support for students including undergraduate, graduate, and postdoctoral fellowships. In no case shall expenditures of GE Contributions exceed the funds made available by GE for this purpose in any given year, and any available monies not awarded in a particular year shall be added to funds available for expenditure in the following year. GE will make a 2014 GE Contribution in the amount of $\$ 75,000$. For each of the following years of the term, GE shall consider additional annual GE Contributions. These funds are not intended to be invested in the University's endowment but rather used in their entirety for the purposes stated herein. Annual GE Contributions shall be paid semi-annually (in equal portions) and are due as of February $1^{\text {st }}$ and August $1^{\text {" }}$ each year in the term of the program.

GE Cost Share: The elements of GE cost share are generally anticipated to include travel and related expenses to allow for GE employees to consistently connect with Purdue personnel and students on Purdue's campus to further the objectives set forth under this agreement.

Purdue shall annually provide supportfor general research endeavors in the area of advanced manufacturing in an amount equivalent to the GE Sponsored Research funding. It is expected that the majority of this support will be achieved through $3^{\text {rd }}$ party sponsored research, participation in advanced manufacturing-based consortiums, cost share and other activities. The degree to which a given element of support fulfills the intent of this agreement shall be made by mutual consent between the parties.

USEOFNAME

All public announcements or media contact relating to this MOU shall be pre-approved by each Party in writing. Each Party shall make such efforts as are fasible and practical botily the ohber prior to responding to unsolicited media inquiries. or, if such notice is not leasible or practical. notify the other Party of any inguiry immediately thereater.

Fach Party agrees that neither shall use the names trademarks or logos of the other Party of of its employees (including. but no limited lo, in any document intended wo made public, any press releases. public anomonements. Publications or fundrasing endeavors) without the prior writen consem of the other Party.

TERMINATION

Either Party may terminate this MOU with or without cause at any time by giving thirty (30) days written notice when it is determined that termination is in either parly's best interest. Any individual activity agreement in elleet at the time of termination of this MOU will remain in effect under the terms of the activity agrement.

GOVERNING LAW

This MOU shall be governed and construed in aceordance with the laws of the State of Indiana.

RELATIONSHIP OFTHE PARTIES

The Parties agree that in the performance of this contract. the Parties are acting as independent contractors and not as agents, an employee, partners, joint ventures or associates of one another. Neither Party is authorized to act on behalf of the other for any purpose.

NON-DISCLOSURE OF CONFIDENTIAI, INFORMATION

The Parties hereto agree that in their performance under this MOU all information or intellectual property marked or characterized as contidential or proprietary to Purdue or GE will be managed pursuant to a standard of care nomally given to sensitive or confidential information. When further warmated or requested by either of the Parties hereto, aceeptable forms of Non-Diselosure Agreement will be executed as further evidence of the mutual commitment.

NOTICES

All motices and communications under this MOU shall be addressed the person below. All notices shall be effective upon receipt. Either party may unilaterally change the contact person below by giving written notice to the other Party.

GENERAL

This instrument contains the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, and any representation, promise or condition in connection therewith not incorporated herein shall not be binding on either Party. No modification of the terms of this MOU shall be valid unless made in writing and signed by authorized representatives of the Parties.

IN WITNESS THEREOF, the parties have executed this agreement as of the day and year last written below.


Michael S. Idelchik
Vice President - Advanced Technology GE Global Research
